abstract.text: A type to represent HID usage pages.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A HID usage page combines with a HID usage to specify the intended functionality for the associated item.
Associated items can be descriptors, devices, reports, report data, elements, etc..
Currently unsupported cases can be used as
, but may be added as supported cases later.

communicating-with-human-interface-devic.alt: An image showing the Swift logo on the left. Three arrows emerge from it and point to the right. The first arrow points to a game controller. The second arrow points to a mouse. The third arrow points to a keyboard.

abstract.text: Interact with keyboards, mice, and other human interface devices.
Interact with and obtain data from devices such as keyboards and mice.
A client of a physical or virtual HID compatible peripheral.
Errors that the framework can throw.
The localization codes that some HID devices declare to specify conformance to a certain format or language.
Common transport types that transmit data to or from a HID device.
A representation of an item from a report descriptor for a HID device.
Data associated with a HID element.
A collection of items from a report descriptor for a HID device.
A base protocol for element update types.
A type to represent the report IDs of HID reports.
Types for HID reports.
A type to represent HID usage pages.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are equal.
Hashes the essential components of this value by feeding them into the
given hasher.
The hash value.
Creates a HID usage page from raw page and usage values.
The usage page value.
The usage value.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
